page.title: 17Westcliff Estate.
page.content: (A view by Riddings Junior School.) On Westcliff Estate, we saw lots of different houses with considerable contrasts between them. Here are some of the types of houses we saw:- detatched, dormer houses , bungalows, flats and a type of terraced house. Some of the contrasts between the houses that we saw, were very different, for example, at one end of Whitman Road, it was very peaceful, whilst at the other end more children were playing. On one road on the estate there was a mixture of detatched, semi-detatched and dormer houses, all of which were built between nineteen and twenty-one years ago. All of these houses had garages and both front and back gardens with well kept lawns and flower beds. (continued.)
